definition: can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])

sentences.english: I look to the pleasure of seeingyou again in the morning.
sentences.chinese: 我等着明天早晨再跟你幸會。

sentences.english: Miss Chou heung, I didn't have a chance to thank you.
sentences.chinese: 秋香姐，幸會幸會，上次的事情我還沒向你道謝呢。

sentences.english: Nice to meet you, Mr Taylor.
Nice to meet you! My name is John.
sentences.chinese: 幸會，我是約翰，請多指教。

definition: to mock/to be ridiculed/to incur ridicule through one's poor performance (humble)
(final particle equivalent to 了[le5])/(particle calling attention to, or mildly warning of, a situation)
(sentence-final particle expressing exhortation)/(syllable filler in a song)
(old) commanding general/commander-in-chief/(Qing dynasty) title for a governor-general (provincial military governor) 總督|总督[zong3 du1]
to err/to dial a wrong number/to make a typo
Brothers!/brethren/dude (colloquial)/brother (diminutive form of address between males)
senior female fellow student or apprentice/daughter (older than oneself) of one's teacher
(coll.) father's older brother/uncle/term of respect for older man
to pay respects/to wish good health/in Qing times, a specific form of salutation (see also 打千[da3 qian1])
to regret not having met earlier (idiom); It is nice to meet you finally./It feels like we have known each other all along.
